sen.j: 里村紹巴（さとむら じょうは、大永5年（1525年） - 慶長7年4月14日 (旧暦)（1602年6月2日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の連歌師。
sen.e: Joha SATOMURA (1525 - June 2, 1602) was a linked-verse-teacher 'Rengashi' during the Warring States period.

sen.e: He assumed the surname 'Satomura' in his adulthood and it is said that his original surname was the Matsui clan.

sen.j: 連歌を周桂（しゅうけい）に学び、周桂の死後里村昌休（しょうきゅう）につき、里村家を継いだ。
sen.e: He studied composing a linked verse 'Renga' under Shukei, and after the death of Shukei, he studied under Shokyu SATOMURA and inherited the Satomura family.

sen.j: その後公家の三条西公条をはじめ、織田信長・明智光秀・豊臣秀吉・三好長慶・細川幽斎・島津義久・最上義光など多数の武将とも交流を持ち、天正10年（1582年）、明智光秀が行った「愛宕百韻」に参加したことは有名である。
sen.e: Later, he had relationship with the court noble Kineda SANJONISHI, and a lot of military commanders Nobunaga ODA, Mitsuhide AKECHI, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, Yusai HOSOKAWA, Yoshihisa SHIMAZU, and Yoshiaki MOGAMI, and it is well-known that he participated in 'Atagohyakuin' conducted by Mitsuhide AKECHI in 1582.

sen.j: 本能寺の変後には豊臣秀吉に疑われるも難を逃れた。
sen.e: After the Incident of Honnoji, even though he was once suspected about his loyalty by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, he could escaped the danger of being executed.

sen.j: 40歳のとき宗養の死で連歌界の第一人者となるが、文禄4年（1595年）の豊臣秀次事件に連座して近江国園城寺（三井寺）の前に蟄居させられた。
sen.e: When the leading linked-verse teacher Soyo died, Joha SATOMURA became the leading figure in the linked-verse arena at the age of 40, but he was implicated in the Incident of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI in 1595 and was placed under house arrest in front of Enjoji Temple (generally known as Mitsuidera Temple) in Omi Province.

sen.j: 連歌の円滑な進行を重んじ連歌論書『連歌至宝抄』を著したほか、式目書・式目辞典・古典注釈書などの著作も多く、『源氏物語』の注釈書『紹巴抄』、『狭衣物語』の注釈書『下紐』などが現存している。
sen.e: He stressed the importance on smoothness throughout the process of composing a linked verse; he wrote a collected papers on Renga "Renga Shihosho" and a lot of books including a book on administrative code, a dictionary of administrative code, and commentaries on classics, some of which including a commentary on "Genji Monogatari" "Johasho", and a commentary on "Sagoromo Monogatari""Shitahimo" are extant.

sen.j: 紹巴は最上義光の連歌師、一花堂乗阿など時宗の僧と交流があり、後に里村家からは宝永5年（1707年）に時宗の遊行上人を継承した遊行48代賦国（ふこく）が出た。
sen.e: Joha had relationship with the Jishu sect monks including Ikkado Joa, who was a linked-verse teacher of Yoshiaki MOGAMI; later in 1707, a descendant of the Satomura family became the 48th Yugyo Fukoku who succeeded to the head of the Jishu sect Yugyoshonin.
